conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram to determine work done and calculate heat transferred using the first law of thermodynamics.

The image is a p-V diagram showing the path of an ideal gas from state A to state B and then to state C, with pressure on the vertical axis and volume on the horizontal axis. Temperature at state A is 27°C.
Identify the path: Gas moves from state A to state B and then to state C, indicating a change in pressure and volume.
Calculate work done using the area under the path on the p-V diagram, assuming work is calculated using change in volume and pressure.
Apply the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Assume ΔU = 0 for an ideal gas at constant temperature since temperature change is not provided.
With ΔU = 0, the equation becomes 0 = Q - W, so Q = W.
Conclusion: Assume heat transferred equals work done, which is not explicitly calculated.
